page.title: 06COUSLAND'S LOCAL POLICEMAN.
page.content: P.C.BOB BAIRD,WHO HAS BEEN IN THE FORCE FOR 13 YEARS,HAS BEEN THE COMMUNITY POLICEMAN FOR TWO MONTHS.HIS AREA COVERS COUSLAND,EDGEHEAD,FALA AND PATHHEAD-VILLAGES SOUTH OF DALK- EITH. HE PATROLS HIS AREA ON A 50CC. MOPED, WHICH IS SLOW,BUT ALLOWS HIM TO KEEP IN DIRECT CONTACT WITH THE PUBLIC. PROBLEMS ARISE IN WINTER,BECAUSE DEEP SNOW CAN PREVENT ANY FORM OF ROAD TRANSPORT REACHING THESE VILLAGES.HE USES A TWO CHANNEL RADIO TO CONTACT HEADQUARTERS AT DALKEITH POLICE STAT- ION. THERE IS NO SUCH THING AS A TYPICAL DAY FOR HIM BECAUSE HIS DUTIES ARE CONTROLLED BY EVENTS,SUCH AS A ROAD ACCIDENT,ROBBERY OR SCHOOL VISIT.HE HAS BEEN TRAINED TO FACE THE DANGER IN HIS JOB AND CAN CALL ON THE HELP OF POLICE DOGS.IT'S A SATISFYING JOB.
